text: Xavien "Zay" Kevonn Flowers (born September 11, 2000) is an American football wide receiver. He plays for the Baltimore Ravens of the National Football League (NFL). ==College== He was recruited out of NSU University School as a three-year recruit by both ESPN and Rivals.com. Flowers started his career by playing college football at Boston College for the Eagles. He recorded 56 receptions for 892 yards and nine touchdowns on his way to becoming a first team All-Atlantic Coast Conference. On December 1, 2022, Flowers said that he was going to enter the 2023 NFL Draft. ==NFL== On April 27, 2023, the Baltimore Ravens drafted Flowers with the 22nd pick in the first round of the 2023 NFL Draft. On June 15, Flowers agreed to a 4-year, $14 million fully guaranteed rookie contract. On September 1, Flowers made his NFL debut with the Ravens in a 25-9 win over the Houston Texans. On October 15, Flowers scored his first NFL touchdown in a 24-16 win against the Tennessee Titans. In Week 17, the Ravens defeated the Miami Dolphins 56â€“19. During the game, Flowers broke a Ravens franchise record for receiving yards by a rookie after scoring a 75 yard touchdown. ==Personal life== Flowers' mother died from a head injury when he was only five years old. His brother was murdered when he was in high school. ==References== == Other websites == * *Baltimore Ravens profile Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:African-American players of American football Category:American football wide receivers Category:Baltimore Ravens players Category:Sportspeople from Fort Lauderdale, Florida
title: Zay Flowers
